summary: HyImpulse will attend Luft- und Raumfahrttag 2025 in Stuttgart on June 5th to present its hybrid rocket technology. [cite: 1, 2, 4]
HyImpulse to participate in the ISAM Conference 2025 in Belfast on June 4th to discuss its hybrid propulsion technology and potential collaborations. [cite: 6, 7]
HyImpulse CEO Christian Schmierer to speak on affordable space access with hybrid propulsion at TECH by Handelsblatt in Heilbronn on May 26th. [cite: 8, 9]
HyImpulse is hiring for Recruiter/Talent Acquisition and Personnel Administrator roles in Neuenstadt am Kocher, starting immediately. [cite: 11, 17]
HyImpulse to attend SmallSat Europe 2025 in Amsterdam on May 27-28 to showcase its hybrid propulsion technology. [cite: 20, 21, 22]
HyImpulse provides an overview of its validated hybrid rocket propulsion (paraffin/LOX) highlighting cost-efficiency, safety, performance, control, and sustainability. [cite: 23, 24, 26]
HyImpulse marks the one-year anniversary of its SR75 maiden launch by sharing media coverage highlights. [cite: 27, 28, 30]
HyImpulse commemorates the SR75 maiden launch anniversary, highlighting its validation of hybrid propulsion for future missions like the SL1 orbital launch. [cite: 31, 32, 33]
HyImpulse congratulates ATMOS Space Cargo on the Phoenix 1 re-entry capsule launch (SpaceX Bandwagon-3), for which HyImpulse supplied the primary structure and key components. [cite: 34]

HyImpulse highlights its participation in the 12th DLR Industrial Days (April 15-16) focused on European space transport, where DLR recognized HyImpulse's innovative potential. (This is a repost by HyImpulse of DLR's post, with added HyImpulse commentary). [cite: 41, 42, 47]

HyImpulse highlights its participation in the 12th DLR Industrial Days (April 15-16) focused on European space transport, where DLR recognized HyImpulse's innovative potential. (This is a repost by HyImpulse of DLR's post, with added HyImpulse commentary, seemingly identical to the previous post). [cite: 53, 54, 57]
HyImpulse welcomed MEP Prof. Dr. Andrea Wechsler to discuss their technology's contribution to European space autonomy and innovation. [cite: 60, 61]

HyImpulse participated in acitoflux's New Space track at NCA Innovation Day, showcasing its hybrid technology and discussing Europe's space startup ecosystem. (HyImpulse reposts acitoflux's summary with their own commentary). [cite: 64, 65, 66]
HyImpulse (Fotis Christodoulopoulos) pitched at the UK Space Agency's Space Investment Pitch Day on March 18th. (HyImpulse reposts UK Space Agency's announcement). [cite: 77, 79]
HyImpulse congratulates Isar Aerospace on its Spectrum test flight and announces its upcoming second SR75 launch from SaxaVord Spaceport, to be followed by the SL1 orbital vehicle. [cite: 83]
HyImpulse CEO Christian Schmierer to discuss maiden launch insights and future plans in a South Australia space sector webinar on April 2nd. [cite: 104, 105, 106]

HyImpulse delivered the primary structure and Ballute Inflation System for ATMOS Space Cargo’s PHOENIX 1 return vehicle, marking its first hardware to fly to orbit (NET April 2025 on Falcon 9). [cite: 110, 111, 112]
HyImpulse is hiring a Turbomachinery Engineer (M/F/D) in Glasgow (UK) or Neuenstadt (DE) for powerpack unit development. [cite: 115]
HyImpulse reports a positive experience attending Space-Comm Expo 2025.
HyImpulse to exhibit at Space-Comm Expo 2025 in London on March 11-12 (Booth A14). [cite: 117]
HyImpulse featured on SWR Aktuell (German) discussing its cost-effective, safe, and sustainable hybrid rocket technology and SR75 test flight. [cite: 120, 121]
HyImpulse hosted DLR leadership for an update on SR75 & SL1 progress; DLR's post (German) detailed the SR75's May 3, 2024 test flight and SL1's payload capacity. [cite: 124, 125, 126, 127]
HyImpulse is hiring a Production Engineer (M/F/D) in Neuenstadt am Kocher (job description in German and English). [cite: 132, 134]
HyImpulse is hiring Embedded Systems Engineers (Software Development & Hardware Design) in Neuenstadt am Kocher. [cite: 137, 140]
HyImpulse is hiring a Mechatronics Engineer (M/F/D) for launch vehicle guidance systems in Neuenstadt am Kocher. [cite: 143]
HyImpulse is hiring a Test Bench & Operations Engineer and a Launch Facility Design Engineer in Glasgow, Scotland for its Shetland Testing Facility. [cite: 148, 149, 151]
HyImpulse reviews 2024, highlighting the SR75 successful launch as a key milestone demonstrating its hybrid propulsion technology. [cite: 154, 155]

HyImpulse is hiring for multiple roles: Lead Development Engineer (Glasgow), Space Licensing and Systems Engineer (Glasgow), Business Development Manager (Neuenstadt), and Structural Analysis Engineer (Neuenstadt, Feb 2025). [cite: 160, 162, 165, 167, 169]
HyImpulse unveils its HyMOVE orbital transfer vehicle and announces a partnership with "boost" for small satellite missions. [cite: 172]
HyImpulse featured in Aerospace America's Year in Review for its SR75 hybrid rocket launch, acknowledged by the AIAA Hybrid Rockets Technical Committee. [cite: 174, 177]
HyImpulse is hiring an Industrial Mechanic (M/F/D) in Neuenstadt am Kocher (job description in German and English). [cite: 181, 183]
HyImpulse continues its partnership with Astos Solutions for SL1 flight software and GNC development, formalized at Space Tech Expo 2024. [cite: 184, 185, 186]
HyImpulse thanks visitors after participating in Space Tech Expo 2024 in Bremen. [cite: 188]
HyImpulse thanks the German Aerospace Center (DLR) for its Boost! Program funding supporting SL1 development.
HyImpulse secures €11.8 million in ESA funding to accelerate Small Launcher 1 (SL1) development. [cite: 189]
HyImpulse to exhibit at Space Tech Expo Europe in Bremen (Nov 19-21, booth #ZZ44). [cite: 190]

HyImpulse wins the Aerospace Land Award, highlighting its SR75 Australian launch ('Made in Baden-Württemberg' propulsion) and plans for SL1 launch and SR75 commercialization. (Post in German and English). [cite: 192, 193, 194]
HyImpulse is exhibiting at IAC 2024 (booth MS-H10-3). [cite: 211]
HyImpulse is hiring a Launch Vehicle Systems Engineer in Glasgow, Scotland (flexible working). [cite: 212]
HyImpulse attending IAC 2024 in Milan (Booth S-H10-3, German Pavilion) with Mario Kobald, Christian Schmierer, and Altynay Demeubayev. [cite: 215]
HyImpulse is hiring a Propulsion Engineer in Neuenstadt am Kocher for hybrid motor development and test support. [cite: 216]
HyImpulse attending Space-Comm Expo in Glasgow (Booth E1) with joint venture Carbon Launch Systems. [cite: 219]
HyImpulse is hiring a DFM Engineer in Neuenstadt am Kocher (job description in German). [cite: 221]
HyImpulse releases a behind-the-scenes video of its May 3rd SR75 launch and announces the next SR75 launch from SaxaVord Spaceport next year, followed by SL1 orbital launch. [cite: 224]
HyImpulse signed an MOU with nanosatellite mission provider Spacemanic at the SmallSat conference. [cite: 225, 226]
HyImpulse celebrates founding employees Jéréme Messineo, Romain Verges, Andrea De Pace, Isabella Verri, Davide Corbo, and Detlef Zimmerling for their loyalty. [cite: 228, 229]
HyImpulse highlights partner IABG's crucial testing of SR75 rocket tanks, including Europe's first LOX-compatible type 5 tank. [cite: 232, 233, 234]
HyImpulse reposts a feature (German) by Baden-Württemberg's federal representation, detailing the SR75's May 3, 2024 launch in Australia (paraffin/LOX, 250kg to 250km). [cite: 239, 240]
HyImpulse welcomed Staatssekretär Patrick Rapp and MdB Alexander Throm to its Neuenstadt HQ to showcase its hybrid propulsion technology and discuss future plans. [cite: 244, 245]
HyImpulse to attend the Small Satellite Conference (SmallSat) Aug 3-8, 2024 (Booth 132) with Mario Kobald, Christian Schmierer, and Altynay Demeubayeva. [cite: 248, 249]
HyImpulse secures £5 million in NSIP funding for its SHARP (Sustainable Hybrid Accelerated Rocket Programme). [cite: 251]
HyImpulse thanks UK Space Agency for the £5 million NSIP funding for SHARP, aiding UK launch goals. [cite: 252, 253]
HyImpulse releases an official, serialized 3D-printed SR75 "Light this candle!" mission patch for sale. [cite: 257, 258]
HyImpulse showcases its SR75 cryogenic CFRP type V tank, co-developed with Adamant Composites and Carbon Launch Systems, for reduced mass and production time. [cite: 259]
HyImpulse thanks astronaut Dr. Ulf Merbold for his visit and aerospace insights (post in German). [cite: 260]
HyImpulse attended the 59th Stallwächterparty in Berlin, showcased its SR75 launch to PM Winfried Kretschmann and ESA astronauts. [cite: 261, 262]
HyImpulse thanks German Chancellor Scholz for his congratulations (post in German, video by phoenix). [cite: 263]
HyImpulse highlights its partnership with "THE LAND Baden-Württemberg," acknowledging its support for regional innovation. [cite: 266, 267]
HyImpulse highlights its partnership with Campus Founders to strengthen the Heilbronn startup ecosystem. [cite: 272]
HyImpulse is hiring a Fluid Systems Engineer in Neuenstadt am Kocher, Germany. [cite: 275]
HyImpulse offers a Marketing & Business Development internship in Neuenstadt am Kocher. [cite: 277]
HyImpulse CEO Christian Schmierer presented suborbital mission insights and joined panels at ESA's #STE2024 conference. [cite: 279]
HyImpulse acknowledges the European Space Agency (ESA) as a key partner in their launch campaign. [cite: 283, 284]
HyImpulse CEO Christian Schmierer to give a keynote on the "Light this Candle" mission at #STE2024 (Thursday, 10:30 AM) and join a panel. [cite: 286, 288]
HyImpulse thanks partner UK Space Agency for instrumental support in testing, technology development, and launch success. [cite: 291]

HyImpulse thanks Dr. Anna Christmann for her support and for flying her photo on the SR7S Australian launch; Dr. Christmann's post (German) highlights the launch's NewSpace significance. [cite: 292, 293, 296, 297]
HyImpulse highlights partner Southern Launch, provider of the Koonibba Test Range in South Australia used for their launch. [cite: 299, 300, 302]
HyImpulse wishes EURO2024 success, revealing a German football jersey flew on its SR75 May 3rd Australian launch, and wishes SaxaVord well (post in German & English). [cite: 304, 305, 308, 309, 310]
HyImpulse highlights partner Adamant Composites' role in developing technology, including the full-composite LOX tank for SL1 via their JV, Carbon Launch Systems. [cite: 313, 314, 315]
HyImpulse hiring a part-time Accountant/Commercial Clerk (m/f/d) in Neuenstadt am Kocher starting Sept 1st (description in German). [cite: 317]
HyImpulse thanks partner DLR Institute of Space Propulsion for their support during the SR75 launch campaign. [cite: 319]
HyImpulse thanks partner DSV Global Transport and Logistics for managing the time-critical transport for their Australian launch campaign (post in German & English). [cite: 321, 323]
HyImpulse shares a new video angle of the SR75 "Light This Candle" launch, one month after the event. [cite: 328]
HyImpulse provides a roundup of recent event participation: Space Propulsion Conference (Luzern), Space Conference (Glasgow), and #4S Symposium (Mallorca). [cite: 329]
